p: The p-AV showed a rapid increase up to 30 to 40 days of storage in duck, chicken, and swine skin fats ( Fig. 1C). These p-AVs remained constant until the end of the storage period and there was no significant difference between the three groups at the end of storage (P > 0.05). In contrast, the p-AV in bovine skin fat gradually increased during 60 days of storage ( Fig. 1C). The p-AVs tended to depend on the USFA content (p<0.05). High USFA contents have been shown to be the major factor influencing p-AV in samples ( Zuo et al., 2017). Our p-AV data also demonstrated a relationship between the amount of USFA and the production of aldehydes and ketones during storage.
